intro: Petalostylis millefolium, commonly known as the common petalostylis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are compound, with numerous narrow leaflets arranged in a羽状 pattern. The flowers are usually short-lived, blooming in early spring and attracting various pollinators.
